title: Decorative Outline (Retro?) Font - Used in holiday banner
content:
Font: 

 TXTSanta 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184923/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [il\_570xN.645301289\_fxkn.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184923/http:/typophile.com/files/il_570xN.645301289_fxkn_1.jpg) | 51.3 KB |
author: b1thrift

comments.content:
Please do not multiple post. This board is strictly volunteer and it's a weekend, so it may take a while for someone to respond.

The typeface appears to be based on Goudy Handtooled, to which someone added swashes and other decorative touches (curled terminals on the C and S, decorative crossbar on the T):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/goudy-handtooled/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184923/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/goudy-handtooled/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/tilde/goudy-handtooled/")

Whether it is an actual typeface or a custom piece of typography will be hard to determine given the size and resolution of your sample.

EDIT—Found it. TXTSanta Font:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lettering-delights/txt-santa-font/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184923/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lettering-delights/txt-santa-font/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lettering-delights/txt-santa-font/")

Thank you!

Sorry about the multiple postings. On my thread it only shows once?

You're welcome.

Other two posts appeared here:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/120978](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184923/http:/typophile.com/node/120978 "http://typophile.com/node/120978")
